snippet: Ten members of Lehava, a far-right Jewish group, were arrested on suspicion of incitement and calls for acts of violence motivated by racism, a day after three were arrested in an arson case.
abstract: Israeli police say ten members of extreme-right Jewish group Lehava have been arrested on suspicion of incitement and calls for acts of violence against Arabs; move comes after three in group were charged in November arson incident.
lead_paragraph: Ten members of Lehava, a far-right Jewish group, were arrested on suspicion of incitement and calls for acts of violence motivated by racism, a day after three were arrested in an arson case.

headline.main: Israel Cracks Down on Lehava, a Group Tied to Anti-Arab Acts
headline.print_headline: Israel Cracks Down on a Group Tied to Anti-Arab Acts
